title: Telecommunications
abstract: CHRONICLES OF CORPORATE CHANCE: MANAGEMENT LESSONS FROM AT&T AND ITS OFFSPRING by Leonard Schlesinger, et al. (Lexington, MA: Lexington Books, 1987—$27.95, ISBN 0-669-13685-9) THE RAPE OF MA BELL: THE CRIMINAL WRECKING OF THE BEST TELEPHONE SYSTEM IN THE WORLD by Constantine Kraus and Alfred Duerig (Secaucus, NJ: Lyle Stuart, 1988—$19.95, ISBN 0-8184-0468-X) THE REWIRING OF AMERICA: THE FIBER OPTICS REVOLUTION by C. David Chaffee (New York: Academic Press, 1988—$24.95, ISBN 0-12-166360-4) TELECOMMUNICATIONS REPORTS and COMMUNICATIONS REPORTS (Datapro, Computers & Communications Information Group, 1805 Underwood Blvd., Delran, NJ 08075—$30.00 each plus shipping with discounts for large orders, no ISBN given) DIGITAL CELLULAR RADIO by George Calhoun (Norwood, MA: Artech House, 1988—price not given but about $60.00, ISBN 0-89006-266-8) MANAGER'S GUIDE TO THE NEW TELECOMMUNICATIONS NETWORK by Lawrence Gasman (Norwood, MA: Artech House, 1988—$60.00, ISBN 0-898006-296-X) MINIMUM RISK STRATEGY FOR ACQUIRING COMMUNICATIONS EQUIPMENT AND SERVICES by Nathan J. Muller (Norwood, MA: Artech House, 1989—$72.00, ISBN 0-89006-304-4) SATELLITE INFORMATION SYSTEMS by Edward Binkowski (Boston: G.K. Hall, 1988—$38.00, ISBN 0-8161-1856-6, with a paperback also available) JONES DICTIONARY OF CABLE TELEVISION TERMINOLOGY by Glenn R. Jones (Jones 21st Century, 9697 E. Mineral Ave., Englewood, CO 80112—$14.95, ISBN 0-9453373-00-7) HDTV: PLANNING FOR ACTION by Kenneth R. Donow (National Association of Broadcasters, 1771 N St., NW, Washington, DC 20036—$40.00, paper; $20.00 to NAB and BEA members, ISBN 0-89324-045-1) HIGH-DEFINITION TECHNOLOGY: THE CRITICAL CHOICES (Annenberg Washington Program, 1455 Pennsylvania Ave. NW, Suite 200, Washington, DC 20004—apparently free on request, no ISBN given) TECHNOLOGIES OF CONTROL: THE NEW INTERACTIVE MEDIA FOR THE HOME by Kevin G. Wilson (Madison: University of Wisconsin Press, 1988—$37.50/15.25, ISBN 0-299-11370-1 [cloth]; 0-299-11374-4 [paper]) THE TECHNOLOGY GAMBLE: INFORMATICS AND PUBLIC POLICY—A STUDY OF TECHNOLOGY CHOICE by Cees J. Hamelink (Norwood, NJ: Ablex, 1988—$29.50, ISBN 0-8939M78-9) THE VCR AGE edited by Mark R. Levy (Newbury Park, CA: Sage—Vol 30, No. 5, May/June 1987) THE FORMULA IS EVERYTHING: COSTING AND PRICING IN THE TELECOMMUNICATIONS INDUSTRY by Anthony Oettinger (Harvard Program on Information Resources Policy, 200 Aiken, Harvard University, Cambridge, MA 02138—price not given, paper) SATELLITE ISSUES: 1987—REVIEW AND ASSESSMENT OF MAJOR ISSUES AFFECTING THE BROADCAST INDUSTRY by Marcia DeSonne (National Association of Broadcasters, 1771 N St. NW, Washington, DC 20036—price not given, paper) TELECOMMUNICATIONS MODERNIZATION: WHO PAYS? by Nancy Wheatley, et al. (National Regulatory Research Institute, 1080 Carmack Rd., Columbus, OH 43210—price not given, paper) COMMUNICATION CANADA: ISSUES IN BROADCASTING AND NEW TECHNOLOGIES edited by Rowland Lorimer and Donald Wilson (Toronto: Kagan & Woo, 1988: $24.95, paper, ISBN 0-921099-03-7,308 pp.) ESSAYS IN JOURNALISM edited by Heather Hiscox (London, Ontario: Graduate School of Journalism, University of Western Ontario, 1988—price not reported, paper, ISBN 0-7714-0988-5, 212 pp.) DOCUMENTS ON CANADIAN BROADCASTING edited by Roger Bird (Ottawa: Carleton University Press distributed by Oxford University Press, 1988—$39.95/24.95, ISBN 0-88629-0732 cloth/0-88629-0724 paper, 756 pp.) THE COLONIZED EYE: RETHINKING THE GRIERSON LEGEND by Joyce Nelson (Toronto: Between the Lines, 1988—$25.95/12.95, ISBN 0-919946-91-7, 144 pp.)
